properties.areaDesc: Southern Brevard County; Martin; Northern Brevard County; St. Lucie; Indian River; Coastal Volusia
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 26 at 2:09AM EST until January 26 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, large breaking waves of
around 5 feet in a long period swell. For the High Rip Current
Risk, frequent strong and dangerous rip currents will occur as
significant wave energy will be piling in behind the sand bar
today. This will create numerous breaches and channels for rips
to form in the surf zone.

* WHERE...Volusia, Brevard, Indian River, St. Lucie, and Martin
Counties.

* WHEN...Through 7 PM this evening.

* IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away
from shore into deeper water. large breaking waves can knock you
down and make you even more susceptible to being caught in the
seaward pull of a rip current.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur this morning around
900 AM. While rip currents will be present all day, they will be
more frequent and pull especially strong between 12 noon and 600
PM due to tidal effects.
properties.instruction:
Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away
from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the
sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as jetties and
piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards. Entering the ocean is not
advised today due to both the dangerous surf conditions and the
frequent, strong rip current activity.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH 7 PM... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH 7 PM
